alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 9:00AM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Yampa River near Maybell affecting Moffat County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Yampa River near Maybell. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the Yampa River reaches bankfull in spots which would result in minor flooding of low-lying agricultural land and some bank erosion. At 11.0 feet, the boat ramp in the Maybell Bridge Campground/Yampa River Access Point becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 10.9 feet early Thursday morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (9 am MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Yampa River Maybell 12.0 10.0 Sun 8 am MDT 9.9 10.4 10.5 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
